meanings.definition: To pull something forcefully or abruptly.
meanings.sent1: She yanked the door open when she was in a hurry.
meanings.sent2: He yanked the rope to start the lawnmower.
meanings.sent3: The cat yanked the toy mouse around the room playfully.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind yanked the umbrella out of her hand.
meanings.sent5: The magician yanked the tablecloth, leaving the dishes untouched.

meanings.sent1: She yanked the weeds out of the garden yesterday.
meanings.sent2: He yanked the cord too hard and broke the lamp.
meanings.sent3: The kids yanked the blanket off the sleeping dog for fun.
meanings.sent4: The storm yanked the leaves off the trees in a frenzy.
meanings.sent5: The chef yanked the pan off the stove before it burned.
